message.content:
cs.CR, cs.OS, cs.SE, cs.SY, cs.DC 

This paper discusses the security issues related to dynamically allocated memory in the Windows kernel, which falls under the category of operating systems (cs.OS) and security and privacy (cs.CR). The proposed solution is a hypervisor-based system, which involves virtualization and system-level control, making it relevant to system and control (cs.SY) and distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC). Additionally, the paper discusses the protection of third-party drivers, which is related to software engineering (cs.SE).
